data.title: THE UNION TRADE
data.meta_description: Post-rock instrumental band from San Francisco
data.text:
The Union Trade live at The Rickshaw Stop in San Francisco Feb 4th 2015

Filmed by: Daniel Boswell and Randy Panado Edited by: Daniel Boswell New LP "A Place of Long Years" released Feb 3rd 2015 on Tricycle Records (Vinyl, CD, Digital) Music available at: Tricycle Records: tricyclerecords.com/artist/theuniontrade/ Band Camp: theuniontrade.bandcamp.com/ Tunes: itunes.apple.com/us/album/a-place-of-long-years/id929789002 Spotify: open.spotify.com/artist/5XNpznProDTSgi8PDvK1Rc Contacts: Booking: booking@theuniontrade.com Label: don@tricycle-records.com...

Your browser don't support audio player

New single “Murmurations” from upcoming LP “A Place of Long Years” Released

New single from upcoming LP “A Place of Long Years,” Out February 3rd, 2015 on Vinyl, CD, Digital Download. Pre-order now available for limited edition smoky clear vinyl, beautiful matte finish gate fold packaging with free download card. All pre-orders also include a custom limited edition...

New LP “A Place of Long Years” Out Feb 3rd 2015

“A Place of Long Years,” San Francisco-based The Union Trade’s sophomore full-length album, is an instrumental journey that weaves its way through triumphant peaks and barren valleys. This post-rock landscape remains mostly unpeopled, sometimes achingly so, but still abounds with the intimate and epic emotions...

Aquarius Records review of “Everyday Including”

The awesome independent SF record shop Aquarius Records has some nice things to say about , making flattering comparisons to Sebadoh and Seam. Don't forget you can buy Everyday Including there, or buy it from us here UNION TRADE, THE Everyday Including (Tricycle Records) For their second cd...

Kata Rokkar Kuestionnaire

Here's a very nice review of Why We Need Night by the SF blog Kata Rokkar, which also includes a little interview with ten questions we answered. Known for bringing an emotional heft and sense of hope to a usually placid genre, San Francisco’s The Union Tradehave...

The Union Trade, a cog in The Indie Machine
